poem:
Title: The Unanticipated Ballad of Body Betrayal  

In pursuance of youth, a chase unwitting,
Despite age's slow but certain knitting,
A jogger's heart, but hiker's frame,
Strength amidst ache, a body's game..

A twinge speaks loud, a ruthless spring,
A wincing laugh, life's harsh sting.
Unseen torment in the walker's stride,
In the path of pain, no place to hide.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘I got a new hip at 51 – and fell into pain like I have never known’ At 51, I took my body’s capabilities for granted. I ran for much of my 30s and 40s, then, when depleted hormones sapped my energy, I moved to hiking, Hiit sessions, weights and yoga. I felt occasional twinges, but nothing concerning, until one twinge became an ache that turned, in spring 2023, into a searing, stop-you-in-your tracks pain through". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
